conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

In general terms, with a single remaining seat we finalize an offer when (a) we receive an application from the highest-priority available candidate, or (b) it becomes unlikely that higher-priority candidates will apply in the remaining rounds (for example, because the market has progressed and they appear to have secured matches elsewhere), or (c) we reach a later stage of the process where holding the seat further no longer makes sense.

We can’t share whether specific candidates are in contact with us in any round, and we can’t promise a specific round when we will move to the next candidate on our list. That said, your continued interest and commitment are noted. If you have any concrete timing constraints (e.g., an exploding offer or a deadline from another school), you’re welcome to tell us, as that can be relevant to how we manage the remaining rounds.

School_C Admissions
